description: local access services requested for government of canada with offices, migration to wireless and voip solutions
full_summary:
**Local Access Service Saskatchewan**
=====================================

**Reference:** PW-22-01017083

**Contract Notice:**

Shared Services Canada (SSC) invites suppliers to express their interest in providing Local Access Service (LAS) to the Government of Canada with offices located across Saskatchewan.

**Introduction:**

The LAS is currently provided using legacy copper-based services. SSC intends to migrate existing LAS lines to wireless and Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) solutions. This migration has already begun and will take several years to complete.

**Contract Requirements:**

* The contractor must have a minimum of 10 years of experience in delivering complex LAS to large-scale customers.
* The contractor must have at least 5 years of experience in delivering LAS within the last 10 years for the given geographic areas.
* The contractor must have at least 5 years of experience in supporting at least 50% of the volume of total approximate LAS lines across the applicable geographic region.

**Security Requirements:**

The contractor and their personnel must undergo a vendor and personnel security screening.

**Evaluation Criteria:**

Statements of capabilities will be evaluated on a pass/fail basis. Interested suppliers must demonstrate their ability to meet the requirements by submitting a statement of capabilities that clearly outlines their experience and qualifications.

**Submission Guidelines:**

Supplier expressions of interest and statements of capabilities must be submitted to Jean-Charles St-Onge, Procurement Team Leader, by December 27, 2022, at 14:00 EST.

**Important Notes:**

* This contract is subject to the Government Contracts Regulations and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
* The contract term will be for up to 10 years, with an option to continue for an additional 5 years.
* The contract may be used to provide service at locations within the settlement areas of the Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements (CLCAs).ZH
